message.content:
We rationalize the denominator for each fraction: \begin{align*}
\sqrt{5}+\frac{1}{\sqrt{5}} + \sqrt{7} + \frac{1}{\sqrt{7}} &= \sqrt{5}+\frac{\sqrt{5}}{5} + \sqrt{7} + \frac{\sqrt{7}}{7} \\
&=\sqrt{5}\left(\frac{5+1}{5}\right) + \sqrt{7}\left(\frac{7+1}{7}\right)\\
&= 6\cdot\sqrt5 + 8\cdot\sqrt7.
\end{align*}Thus, we have $a=6$, $b=8$, $c=1$ and $a+b+c=6+8+1=\boxed{15}.$
